definitions.example: I heard a holler from over the fence.

definitions.definition: By extension, any communication to get somebody's attention.
definitions.example: If you need anything, just give me a holler.
You can holler at your computer as much as you want, but it won't help anything.

definitions.definition: To call out one or more words

definitions.example: He built himself a cabin in a hollow high up in the Rockies.

definitions.definition: A sunken area or unfilled space in something solid; a cavity, natural or artificial.
definitions.example: the hollow of the hand or of a tree
a hollow in the pit of one's stomach

definitions.definition: (of something solid) Having an empty space or cavity inside.
definitions.example: a hollow tree; a hollow sphere

definitions.definition: (of a sound) Distant, eerie; echoing, reverberating, as if in a hollow space; dull, muffled; often low-pitched.
definitions.example: He let out a hollow moan.

definitions.definition: Without substance; having no real or significant worth; meaningless.
